tidbits.title: Disputed Territory
tidbits.description: Western Sahara is a disputed territory, claimed by both the self-proclaimed Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic (SADR) and Morocco, resulting in a long-standing conflict.

tidbits.title: Geographical Features
tidbits.description: The region includes diverse landscapes, from desert expanses of the Sahara to coastal areas, and it is home to natural resources like phosphate deposits.

tidbits.title: Political Situation
tidbits.description: The political status of Western Sahara remains unresolved, with ongoing efforts by the United Nations to find a mutually acceptable solution for the region's future.
